description: Implements a realistic core-collapse simulation using Lattimer-Swesty EoS data, tracks baryon pressure, energy density, entropy, luminosity and neutrino output, with GPU support.

structure.purpose: Detect and configure NumPy or CuPy depending on GPU availability
Define physical constants and set simulation domain/time grid
Main simulation loop: evaluates time-varying nB, T, then queries EoS for P, eps, cs2, calculates beta_B, stores all in series
Plot time evolution of beta_B, pressure, and energy density. Collapse onset is marked
(Extended) Compute entropy per baryon and density using analytical approximation
Plot all EoS quantities including entropy to visualize detailed core behavior
Compute neutrino-related quantities: instantaneous luminosity L, flux Phi_nu, heating rate Qdot_nu using derived expressions
Plot neutrino outputs (Phi_nu, Qdot_nu) over time
Document method, assumptions, and results at each major milestone
